intro: Pleroma mosenii, commonly known as the Mosenii bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to habitat loss, Pleroma mosenii is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
